fields.description:
This one is kinda flaky and could be tough to recreate.  I've got a set of JIRA issues about 20, that come back from a filter.  I bulk edit all of them and the custom version field dropdown has no versions in it.  I bulk edit one or two of them and the dropdown has the versions.  

I can find no pattern to which ones it will give me the versions on.  Bulk editing any one issue seems to work.  Some pairs work but other pairs don't.  I haven't been able to get any 3 to work.

I've been watching the console output and haven't seen any errors.

Thanks.

fields.description:
If I define a new workflow that is a copy of another one in order to change the name of the steps, JIRA keep displaying the default status names.
JIRA should continue to store the standard status id into the database, but it should display the customized status name in the HTML forms, depending on the workflow associated to the issue.
Else, why could we change the name of a workflow step ?

fields.description:
I have a simple mail notification scheme and whenever an Issue is Assigned I want the email to go to the New Assignee (The Jira Event = Issue Assigned and the Notifications = Current Assignee).
However, the email is going to the previous assignee as well as the new one.  Some users who are assigning a lot of bugs to other users are finding this very annoying.  Is there any way to ensure only the New Assignee gets the email.

Thanks,

Ross.
fields.summary: Jira Sending Email To Old Asignee As Well As New One

fields.description:
Hi there,

Is there a way to locate an issue based on its history??

For example, can I run a query to show me all issues that were re-opened at one point in time?? The issues *could* be closed now - but I would want to see issues that had a certaiin status at one point or another.

(Bugzilla has a 'Bug Changed' search field  where you can do this sort of thing - locate bugs according to a field change)

Thx! 

BTW - we really like the product!

--Bill

fields.description:
Priority is a very badly mis-named field.

In the actual world, these are two separate things:

Importancy - how important it is for this issue to be solved.
Urgency - how fast this issue must be solved.

Issues are rarely important & urgent. If you have 1000 clients and 1 client can't run your software at all and needs it for his mission-critical tasks, this is urgent, but (from your perspective) not very important.

On the other hand, a bug that is very severe but rarely encountered in daily use is very important but not very urgent.

Priority is, by this definition confusing. If priority is "Critical" does this represent an important or an urgent issue?

Therefore I suggest that you at least make it possible to use this feature either by:
1. moving to important/urgent model instead of priority
2. letting the user decide which model to use (either at install or being able to change it dinamically)
3. at least let the user hide/rename the "Priority" field to - for example - Urgency and add the Importance field.
fields.summary: Importancy & urgency

Is there a way how i can set the width of the navigator columns in the issue navigator?

One of our customers would like to have a table of issues, which includes the whole description. Therefore it would be nice to  be able to set the width of the description column to a minimum value of influence it in some way.

Is there some kind of possbility to do this?

Any hint is welcome.

fields.description:
I've just imported a large number of issues to JIRA from an issue tracker used internal in our company. The conversion is done by transferring the data (of course they are modified to fit the JIRA structure) direkte into Microsoft SQL Server.

After the import JIRA i re-indexed and the Integrity Checker is run. The integrity checker reports errors regarding the Workflow integrity, but the Integrity Checker corrects the errors by itself.

My questions: 

1. Are there any problems in this procedure. Do i miss something?

2. When creating new issues, i cant get the pcounter to be correct. If my last imported issue has no. 1000 and i don't have an issue with no. 1, then the new issue that is created from scratch in JIRA is created with no. 1 instead of 1001. I've tried to update the pcounter field in the project table, but this does not solve the problem. Could you point out where the attribute is set.

3. Do i have to update some of the values manually in then SEQUENCE_VALUE_ITEM table after the import? How is this table used?

Thanks for your help.
fields.summary: External system import

In our case the field "Samenvatting (NL)" is a text field <255 chars, just as the system field "Summary", but it is displayed at half the size of the Summary field (see the screenshot).

fields.description:
Basically I have an open bug with a summary of: "Use <composite-id> once XDoclet supports it" but when I'm in the dashboard view or other views that list multiple issues and show their summaries, the word: "<composite-id>" is swallowed up.

Looks to me like you need to automatically escape these special character sequences if users use them.

I got an issue stuck in a state where it was "In Progress" and not assigned to anyone and any attempts to assign it resulted in a system error.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an issue
2. Assign it to yourself
3. Mark it is "In Progress"
4. Edit the issue changing the issue to be unassigned in the edit form
5. Assign it to someone

Expected results:
 After step 4 the issue should be unassigned and marked as "Open".
 After step 5 the issue thould be "Open" and assigned to the selected user

Actual results:

USE CASE:
I would urgently like to browse and edit in two projects in parallel. Among others, I want to link issues between the two different projects.

I use two differnt JIRA users to make sure to have two different sessions.
I use the Mozilla Firefox 1.0.0 with extended tabbed browsing, alternatively I also tried Firefox in two windows.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5496].
  {panel}

Within a workflow it is possible to assign an issue to a particular user (person), by specifying a Post Function 'Update Issue Field' for the 'Assign To' field, or by using the Post Function 'Assign to Reporter'. What is missing is a means to (re)assign the issue automatically.

Consider the workflow we need in our organisation:

1) Create Issue
2) Open
3) Resolve (Incomplete)
   - Assign To Reporter
4) Reopen Issue / Clarified
   - Assign to Original Assignee / Assign Automatic
5) Open
....

The issue is opened normally. In step 3 the assignee discovers that the issue is incomplete, and Resolves the bug as Inclomplete. Now, the Post Function 'Assign to Reporter' takes care of assigning the bug to the reporter. The Reporter should now be able to add information that will make the issue complete, and Reopen the bug (or use some custom WF action, e.g. 'Clarified'). This should assign the issue to the orginal assignee automatically (throug a Post Function).

The reason this functionality is needed is that we do not want to give all reporters full assign rights, but want to be able to return an issue to a reporter.

A new Post Function should be implemented that is equivalent to the Automatic assign that is used when an issue is created, or a fucntion that assigns it to the previous assignee (the one that sent it back to the reporter, in our example)
fields.summary: Assign to first or last assignee workflow post-function

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days.

We've made the decision to close this request, as we do not reasonably expect to implement it in any future iteration of JIRA. Adding another event that triggers an email notification adds more complexity to JIRA's notification system. The existing options for notifying a user about an issue (using the Share button or @mentioning them in a comment) are sufficient in most cases and leverage existing patterns.
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 16 February 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for your interest in this issue.
 This request is considered a potential addition to our longer-term roadmap.

We'll typically review this request in about 12 months time, at which point we’ll consider whether we need to alter its status.

For the nearest future we've decided to prioritize other areas of the Jira Server roadmap, including:
 * Performance and stability improvements
 * Archiving projects for improved performance
 * Optimising the use of custom fields
 * Improving performance of boards
 * Improving Jira notifications
 * Allowing users to edit shared filters and dashboards
 * Mobile app for Jira Server

We recommend checking out [Jira Watcher Field|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.burningcode.jira.issue.customfields.impl.jira-watcher-field/server/overview], a free app available from the Atlassian Marketplace. Also, you can use "@mentions" in the issue description to notify other users about the issue being created. They can then decide if they wish to watch the issue.

You can learn more about our [approach to highly voted server suggestions here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/A-renewed-approach-to-highly-voted-Server-suggestions-for-Jira/ba-p/688117].

To learn more on how JAC suggestions are reviewed, see our [updated workflow for server feature suggestions|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/An-updated-workflow-for-Server-feature-suggestions/ba-p/721632#M113].

Kind regards,
 Jira Server Product Management
{panel}

fields.description:
Consider the following (and realize that I have not put complete CDATA syntax anywhere in this text, as that might cause the same issue for you lot as we have):


<Issue ...>
        <description>CDATA sometext

<error>
CDATA{ Foo ENDCDATA
</error>
ENDCDATA
</description>
</Issue>

What happened was a QA tester logged a bug with the malformed CDATA section in issues description, that is, they typed CDATA{ - note curly brace was used instead of square [ - so the opening CDATA was ignored, but two closes found

This results in the CDATA section JIRA wrapped around the <description> element in being terminated early, and then the closing </error> element being parsed, causing an XML malformed error ("description" must be terminated by the etc.. etc.)

Fixing the CDATA section in bug fixes the XML insofar as validation goes, however JIRA still won't import until the CDATA section is removed from the description field all together. Removing the CDATA from the description completely, via SQL, got rid of the problem.

This is fairly serious/sneaky because you don't know this has happened to your exports until you try to restore from them..
fields.summary: Backup does not correctly escape CDATA sections in issue description

fields.description:
XML Import shouldn't be such a memory hog.

This is an interesting one. As far as I can tell, the XML import loads all entities to memory and then writes all entities to disk. This is all nice and well when there's more RAM than this needed. However, if more memory is required is > allocated then the system stuggles severly / throws an out of memory exception.

Perhaps a better solution would be to do incremental imports rather bulk. This will probably be slower, but at least it will have a more consistent response time and will actually scale for humungous databases.
fields.summary: XML Import shouldn't be such a memory hog.

fields.description:
Axis fails to generate SOAP stubs with the following error:

[esm@insight wsdl]$ java org.apache.axis.wsdl.WSDL2Java http://issues.mse.jhu.edu/jira/rpc/soap/jiraservice-v1.wsdl
java.io.IOException: Type {http://www.themindelectric.com/exceptions/}exception is referenced but not defined.
        at org.apache.axis.wsdl.symbolTable.SymbolTable.checkForUndefined(SymbolTable.java:653)
        at org.apache.axis.wsdl.symbolTable.SymbolTable.add(SymbolTable.java:533)
        at org.apache.axis.wsdl.symbolTable.SymbolTable.populate(SymbolTable.java:506)
        at org.apache.axis.wsdl.symbolTable.SymbolTable.populate(SymbolTable.java:483)
        at org.apache.axis.wsdl.gen.Parser$WSDLRunnable.run(Parser.java:356)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:534) 

The same error is returned when WSDL2Java is run against Atlassian's wsdl: http://jira.atlassian.com/rpc/soap/jiraservice-v1.wsdl.  The error is pretty clear: a type definition is missing in the <wsdl:types /> element.  I have tried both Axis 1.1 and Axis 1.2 RC2 and they return the same error.  This has been previously reported as CONF-643.

I can successfully generate the Axis stubs by saving a copy of the WSDL locally, and adding the missing type definition:

<xsd:schema targetNamespace="http://www.themindelectric.com/exceptions/">
 <xsd:complexType name="throwable">
   <xsd:all>
     <xsd:element name="name" type="xsd:string"/>
     <xsd:element name="object" type="xsd:string"/>
   </xsd:all>
 </xsd:complexType>
 <xsd:complexType name="exception">
   <xsd:complexContent>
     <xsd:extension base="n13:throwable"/>
   </xsd:complexContent>
 </xsd:complexType>
</xsd:schema>

It seems that Glue doesn't auto-generate this datatype.
fields.summary: Apache Axis cannot generate stub classes from jiraservice-v1.wsdl

fields.description:
Project Tab Panels do not display when required fields partially disabled.

In a situation where there are multiple field layout schemes for a project, if *only one or more* of the layout schemes have a required field hidden, then the tab panels won't appear.

Thus in the default install, where all the tab panels requires fixVersions, if fixVersions is disabled in any of the field layout schemes, then none of the them will appear.

I'm not sure if it should work this way, since there could still be issues with other field layouts which could still be relevant. Thus I *think* it's a bug, but could be convinced otherwise.

We should perhaps document "required fields" for each portlet/panel we write as to not cause confusion.
fields.summary: Project Tab Panels do not display when required fields partially disabled

fields.description:
Raised for jira-root@3SOFT.de

---------------------------------------------------------
PLEASE support this feature.

We add new groups to restrict sets of users to certain projects (and we have many projects and many groups and many users in them).

And there is no way to correct typos (without direct database/XML access).

Imagine the following scenario.

1) add new groups:    projectname-customer-role 
                     (e.g. foobar-birch-telecom-tester, foobar-birch-telecom-developer, ...)
2) add around 30 user to the various groups

3) make new schemes (issue,notification,permission,....) for a new "special" project
4) add the new project -- assign the schemes ....

5) launch the new project
6) two weeks later you get the info from one user
   "hey man - I'm in the group  "foobar-bitch-telcom-tests" it's not bitch it's birch ....
7) Now how should we help the user to get out of a group of bitchs?

???

NB: In this support request screen there is a small description below this big textarea and this description is wrong (here we should not "Enter a one-line summary of the problem"  :-)
fields.summary: Rename support of groups/users

fields.description: I'd like to have the ability to turn of email notification when I'm the assignee and I change, create or someway modify an issue. After all I just got through modifying the issue I don't need to get an email notifying me of the fact.
fields.summary: notification scheme

fields.description: When JIRA Standalone is run on Windows, it writes logs to stdout, which goes to the DOS console where JIRA was started.  This prevents people from being able to send Atlassian a log file when things go wrong, and makes debugging problems with JIRA much harder.
fields.summary: JIRA Standalone on Windows doesn't write a log file

fields.description: Often, issues of different types or in different projects have different sets of possible resolutions. Eg., a 'support request' issue may have the resolution 'resolved locally', which does not make sense for genuine product bugs.
fields.summary: Resolutions per project / issue type

fields.description:
RPC Plugin causing problems during upgrade with JBOSS 3.2.x

Users are getting:
com.atlassian.plugin.PluginParseException: Duplicate plugin key found: 'com.atla
ssian.jira.ext.rpc' 

The workaround is to remove the RPC plugin, but this is clearly not ideal and we need to look at dealing with this.
fields.summary: RPC Plugin causing problems during upgrade with JBOSS 3.2.x

fields.description:
It would be very nice to be able to config custom field visibility and Required by Create and Edit screens for Issues and SubTasks.

The only way to do this w/o modifying JIRA code that I've found is to muck around with the createissue.jsp and editissue.jsp (still haven't done this for sub tasks). However, this is extremely client specific and makes upgrading (where these jsp's are modified) a real hassle. It would be much nicer to add extra options to the admin section which allow config of field visibility/required by create and edit.
fields.summary: Specify custom field Visibility/Required on Create&Edit / Issue and SubTask screens

fields.description: I would like to configure our Jira application to automatically send SMS messages when a new issue is created within our IT project. Please advise on how to setup.
fields.summary: SMS messages from Jira

fields.description: I've entered my custom field with a description, but this is not shown either on the 'View Custom Fields' page or on the create issue page.
fields.summary: CLONE -Custom field description not displayed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5447].
  {panel}

USE CASE:
Release a version.
There are issues with "Fix version/s" is equal to this version and that have as resolution a "Won't Fix" or "Cannot Fix" or any other resolution that fixed.

EXPECTED:
Only issues with status == "Resolved" and resolution == "Fixed" are listed in the release notes.

REAL:
All issues with status == "Resolved" are listed, even those that are "Won't fix" or similar.
fields.summary: Release notes included issues that have not been fixed.

fields.description:
USE CASE:
1. Create an improvement and set a component for this issue.
2. Store the improvement.
3. Create a sub-task for this improvement.

CURRENT SITUATION:
The sub-task has no component.

PROPOSAL:
The the new sub-task shall by default inherit the component of the parent issue, and as a consequence will automaticlly be assigned to the default assignee for this component.
fields.summary: Sub tasks shall inherit the parent issue's component.

fields.description:
Sometimes clicking the "Unassigned" link on the Browse Project page generates the error:
------------------
ERROR

The project you are trying to view does not exist. Try browsing for projects.

If you feel this message is wrong, please consult your administrators about getting the necessary permissions. 
------------------

This happens only sometimes.  

Steps to reproduce?:
1. Restart server
2. Browse to your project
3. Click the Unassigned link in the By Assignee section (bottom right)

I was able to duplicate this on my server and on this server.  The second time I tried on this server it worked (in the Jira project).  I went to another project and tried it there and got the same error.  There appears to be some action that triggers "loading" of the project and after that the error will not occur again for that project.
fields.summary: Unassigned filter causes "PROJECT DOES NOT EXIST" error

fields.description:
In the 'rpc-jira-plugin' and the 'subversion-jira-plugin' examples, there is a build.properties which includes the local '../../lib' directory in the local maven repository.

However, this file is missing from the other plugins, and also from the sample project.

We need to include this file, otherwise people cannot build their plugins.

We should also include this as part of the build process, so that we ensure that the build process works.
fields.summary: Plugin development kit doesn't include 'lib' in local repository

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5443].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/How-does-the-JIRA-team-use-jira-atlassian-com/qaq-p/475688].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

Now that issue JRA-3454 is finally fixed, there's something missing from it:
The sort order reverts to the default "from first to last" everytime the session ends (i.e. the browser closes or you log in from another computer).

This is intuitive and since users wanting this feature usually want the sort order to stay the way they have set it ("from last to first"), I believe this to be a bug, but am marking it as an 'Improvement' anyway.

Sort order should be stored in some kind of per-user preference.
fields.summary: Store comment sort order in user profile

fields.description:
Configure an issue security level that makes issues visible only to users of a certain group. Create an issue and set that security level for that issue. Create a sub-task of the issue.

Expected result: Either it is possible to set the security level on the sub-task, or the sub-task has the same security level as the parent issue.
Actual result: There is no field for entering the security level in the sub-task form, and the sub-task has default security level (visible to everyone).

We have leaked some important business information because of this bug. :-(
fields.summary: Issue security does not work with sub-tasks

fields.description:
All of the JIRA shows national (Slovenian) characters (čšž) correctly, except for the "Show saved filter" portlet - screenshot follows.

The encoding is set to UTF-8.

The following conversion happens:
č -> ￄﾍ
š -> ￅﾡ
ž -> ￅﾾ

Looks like something like this happens:

String s = the_corrrect_string_in;
byte b[] = s.getBytes("UTF-8"); // so far so good

// this uses the platform default encoding, which is not
// UTF-8, but rather something like ISO-8859-2
String t = new String(b); // now, t is wrong
fields.summary: International characters not shown correctly in the Show saved filter portlet

fields.description:
When I try to create an issue that is assigned to and reported by the same user, Jelly Runner replies the script was run successfully, but the issue does not appear in the IssueNavigator or the jiraissue table.  I see no errors in the logs. 

<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.JiraTagLib">
   <jira:Login username="import-user" password="xxx">
      <jira:CreateIssue project-key="KEY" issueType="Bug" priority="Major" summary="SUMMARY" description="DESCRIPTION" duplicateSummary="ignore" assignee="user1" reporter="user1" issueKeyVar="issueKey">
         <jira:AddCustomFieldValue id="customfield_10002" value="somevalue"/>
      </jira:CreateIssue>
  </jira:Login>
</JiraJelly>

If I change the reporter or assignee to a different user, the issue is created successfully.
fields.summary: CreateIssue: If Assignee & Reporter same, creation silently fails

fields.description: When creating a sub-task, fields like "component" and "versions" should be defaulted from the parent task.
fields.summary: Sub-tasks should inherit parent task values

fields.description: An 'edit' link on the Issue Navigator would be nice. I find that navigating to the issue, then clicking edit, is a bit clunky when I know I want to edit the issue immediately.
fields.summary: Issue actions and operations on Issue Navigator
group names should be lower-cased

fields.description:
We have a project that had an Issue Level Security scheme applied with 2 permission levels in it. We created several sample tickets to test the configuration. We then removed one of the permission levels from the security scheme and all associated tickets were no longer visible, yet the Open ticket count still included the count for those now unvisible tickets. We are logged in with an administrative account which has full control over the project.

How can we get the Open ticket count to read correctly again?

We are using MS SQL server as our backend database
fields.summary: Invalid Open Ticket count

fields.description:
It would be good to default the Fix Version, Affect Version and Components of a sub-task to those of the parent task. 
--- OR ---
You could add these 3 fields into the quick-entry sub-tasks table...
fields.summary: Sub tasks should inherit Version & Component details from parent

fields.description: One of the biggest things that is missing at the moment in JIRA is a start date. If we had this we could also easily generate GANTT charts.
fields.summary: Gantt chart support
Don't jar english properties files

Add finnish calendar

fields.description:
It would be nice if you were allowed arbitrary (or at least more than 2) levels of tasks/sub-tasks.  Within a release, the high-level tasks are usually too big to be represented by one level of sub-tasks.

Having more levels would allow JIRA to serve as a project scheduler, and allow users to track all the sub-tasks down to a managable level.
fields.summary: Sub-tasks should be able to have other sub-tasks

fields.description:
On this very page (Create Issue, Step 2 of 2) I am not warned if I navigate away from the page accidentally (eg hitting back, or clicking a link, or opening something in this browser from an external program, or a mouse gesture). If a navigate happens, all my editing is lost.

There should be a standard warning issued upon the appropriate HTML event for navigate-out, asking of whether I am sure I want to discard my editing, OK|Cancel.

It would be nice to also have this feature at all the pages where appropriate, as data loss happens for me from time to time.
fields.summary: No "Navigate Out" Warning When Editing Issue
